Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers, Module C
Section 3: Emergency Preparedness, Response & Recovery

Emergency Supply Kit

It is important that child care facilities establish an emergency supply kit that they take with them for any and all emergencies. If there is a shelter in place the kit should be with them and if they evacuate the building or are relocated the kit should be with them.

First Aid Kit

Every emergency kit should include a first aid kit.

Emergency Contact Information

Copies of files should be in the kit which include emergency contact information, child files, and ID cards with children’s pictures.

Vital Records

Vital records for the facility should be in the kit such as Insurance policies, service contracts, payroll information, important policies and contact information, and a copy of the emergency plan(including facility floor plan, evacuation plan outlined, and printed directions to safe evacuation site).

Care Plans, Meds & Equipment for Special & Chronic Needs

Care plans and medications and equipment for children with special needs and chronic medical conditions should be included in the emergency supply kit.

Water & Food

The kit should include a 24-72- hour supply of water, @ ½ to 1 gallon per person, and cups. There should also be eating utensils, can opener, ready-to-eat canned food, non-perishable food, infant formula, bottles, and baby food. Food allergies should be considered when planning food.

Other Supplies

Other supplies include a whistle for the leader, a fire extinguisher, flashlights and batteries, and a fully charged cell phone and charger and cord. You should also have blankets, paper towels, tissues, toilet paper, towelettes, matches in a waterproof container, non-latex gloves, garbage bags, hand sanitizer, blankets, diapers, diaper wipes, and comfort items like pacifiers and stuffed animals, and games and puzzles to entertain children.

Periodically cycle items to ensure water, food, medications, first aid supplies and any perishable items are current.
